Class Database<T>

java.lang.Object
database.Database<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of entities managed by this database class
Direct Known Subclasses:
AppointmentDB, AppointmentOutcomeRecordDB, DoctorUnavailabilityDB, MedicalRecordDB, MedicineDB, ReplenishmentDB, UserDB
public abstract class Database<T> extends Object
An abstract generic class that defines the structure for a database. This class provides basic CRUD operations and methods for saving and loading data from a CSV file. It uses a singleton eager-loading approach, ensuring data is saved only when the program is closed.

      Creates a new entity in the database.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to be created
      Returns:

      Returns:

    • save

      public abstract boolean save() throws IOException
      Saves the current data in the database to the specified file.
      Returns:
      true if the data was successfully saved
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during saving

    • load

      public abstract boolean load() throws IOException
      Loads the data from the specified file into the database.
      Returns:
      true if the data was successfully loaded
      Throws:

    • saveData

      public void saveData(String filename, List<?> dataList, String header) throws IOException
      Saves a list of data objects to a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the CSV file to save data to
      dataList - the list of data objects to be saved
      header - the header to be written at the top of the CSV file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while saving data

    • readFile

      public List<String> readFile(String filename) throws IOException
      Reads all lines from a CSV file, excluding the header, and returns them as a list of strings.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the CSV file to read
      Returns:
      a list of strings, each representing a line in the CSV file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

    • splitLine

      Splits a line of text into an array of strings using the specified separator (comma).
      Parameters:
      line - the line of text to be split
      Returns:
      an array of strings resulting from the split operation
